intro: Tetrapterocarpon septentrionale subsp. septentrionale, commonly known as the northern tetrapterocarpon, is a member of the Myrtaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It produces woody capsules that contain small, winged seeds. This subspecies is native to parts of eastern North America and is often found in maritime climates.
